entry.title: World Cup Italy 2024: Maps, Results & Splits analysis illustrations

With more varied orienteering, other nations managed to ...

entry.title: World Cup: Switzerland won nail-biting Sprint Relay
entry.summary: Switzerland won the first international sprint relay in 2024, when they were the first to cross the finish line after a nerve-wracking final at the Orienteering World Cup round in Genoa. Finland and Czechia continued to impress by taking second and third place respectively. Strong start Switzerland came out strong in the sun-drenched Nervi Park, […]

entry.summary: Exciting news! Whangarei Orienteering club have officially joined Orienteering New Zealand as a stand alone club. entry.title: Southland School Champs
entry.summary: Southland Orienteering Club’s annual Schools’ Championships attracted over 100 teams from all over Southland as well as Queenstown and Dunedin. There were 6 courses at Fosbender Park, in sand dune and coastal pine forest. The event gave competitors a chance to experience orienteering for the first time and for others to challenge their skills on more difficult courses. entry.title: NZ Secondary Schools | 19 -21 July
entry.summary: Orienteering Wellington is looking forward to welcoming all year 7-13 orienteers from across New Zealand to the Wellington region for three days of high-quality orienteering from the 19th-21st July 2024. entry.title: AIMS Games Entries close on Wed 5 June
entry.summary: There is only ONE WEEK left for you to register for the 2024 Zespri AIMS Games! Registrations close 7:59pm on 5th June 2024.
